title: Restore original global OKLCH theme variables (light/dark)

requirements.text: Replace the app’s global theme CSS variables in `frontend/src/index.css` by updating the `:root` (light) and `.dark` (dark) blocks to use the exact OKLCH variable values provided by the user for all listed tokens, and add any missing custom tokens from the provided list so they are available globally.

quotes: The original color styles are missing... Is it possible for you to restore original style colors?
Here are correct colors for reference I got: :root { ... }  .dark { ... }

1. Yes you can, just so you can fix colors
2. Yes
3. These base colors

acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/index.css`, the `:root` variables exactly match the user-provided values for: `--background`, `--foreground`, `--card`, `--card-foreground`, `--popover`, `--popover-foreground`, `--primary`, `--primary-foreground`, `--secondary`, `--secondary-foreground`, `--muted`, `--muted-foreground`, `--accent`, `--accent-foreground`, `--destructive`, `--destructive-foreground`, `--border`, `--input`, `--ring`, and `--radius`.
In `frontend/src/index.css`, the `.dark` variables exactly match the user-provided values for the same tokens (including `--ring`).

In `frontend/src/index.css`, the following custom tokens are present and match the user-provided values in both light and dark where provided: `--accent-cyan`, `--accent-cyan-tinted`, `--accent-lavender`, `--primary-dark`, `--description-gray`, `--selected-element-light`, `--guide-text`.
After the change, the app is no longer visually “mostly black and white”; backgrounds, borders, and text colors reflect the restored palette in both light and dark modes across all routes.

requirements.text: Ensure the restored theme variables are used consistently by Tailwind utilities and existing component styles by keeping variable formats compatible with the Tailwind config (i.e., variables used via `oklch(var(--token))` must be defined as space-separated OKLCH channels rather than nested `oklch(...)` strings).
acceptanceCriteria: Tailwind color utilities that rely on `oklch(var(--background))`, `oklch(var(--foreground))`, `oklch(var(--border))`, `oklch(var(--accent-cyan))`, etc. render correct colors using the restored values (no invalid CSS color parsing).

Key UI elements that explicitly use theme tokens (e.g., buttons using `bg-accent-cyan`, text using `text-description-gray`, borders using `border-border`) display with the intended restored colors in both light and dark themes.

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose existing UI components instead if needed).
Do not modify immutable hook files: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, or `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`.
Keep all changes scoped to restoring/aligning global theme variables; do not introduce new app features.
nonGoals: Redesigning layouts or adding new UI components beyond what is necessary to verify the restored theme colors.
Changing backend logic or data models.
